title: Sample Book, "Richard Turgeon Designs, Volume 2", 1972–73
medium: Screen printed on vinyl, foil, mylar
provenance: Gift from the designer, Richard Turgeon.
description: Collection of 17 designs with contemporary styling. Most designs are nature-inspired, with several bold geometric designs. Each design is shown in multiple colorways. Titles include: Macao, Djakarta, Bali, Mozambique, Borneo, Sumatra, Java, Claremont, Lemon Tree, Antibes, Dandelions, Southampton, Caravan, Ashanti, Belgravia, Double Dot, and Polka Dot.
justification: Each&nbsp;book contains a dozen or more designs, and each design is shown in multiple colorways. Several of the designs are displayed with complementary papers, and each pattern has a fold-out page demonstrating the full width. Most of Turgeon's work is inspired by natural elements-flowers, shells and animal prints. In addition, each book contains a couple strong geometric patterns. The work is quite representative of early 1970s styling with the designs delicately drawn and rendered quite flat, using bold patterns and bright colors. All the designs are printed on matte or glossy vinyl, or foil.

tombstone.epitaph: Sample Book, "Richard Turgeon Designs, Volume 2", 1972–73.Screen printed on vinyl, foil, mylar. Gift of Richard Turgeon. 2010-25-2-1/103.
